get.summary: Return all projects, optionally filtered, sorted, and paginated.

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [creator.email creator.name creator.username description name owner.email owner.name owner.username].
For example:
  search_filter={"name":"foo","creator.name":"bar"},.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username description name owner.email owner.name owner.username updated_at].
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=-updated_at,+name.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

parameters.name: include_public_projects
parameters.description:
Default is false. If include_public_projects is set to true, then it will return
all projects user has access to, including public projects.

parameters.name: include_all_projects
parameters.description:
Default is false. If include_all_projects is set to true, then it will return
all projects in the workspace if user is a site admin. If user is not a site admin,
then it will be equivalent to making use of flag include_public_projects and will return
all projects user has access to, including public projects.

name.description: The name of the project to create.

visibility.description: The visibility of the project (one of "public", "organization", "private"). Default is private.

git_url.description: Optional git URL to checkout for this project.

template.description:
Optional template to use (Python, R, PySpark, Scala, Churn Predictor)
Note: local will create the project but nothing else, files must be
uploaded separately.

organization_permission.description: If this is an organization-wide project, the visibility to others in the organization.

default_project_engine_type.description:
Whether this project uses legacy engines or runtimes. Valid values are
"ml_runtime", "legacy_engine", or leave blank to default to the site-wide default.

environment.title: The default set of environment variables to run

shared_memory_limit.description: Additional shared memory limit that engines in this project should have, in MB (default 64).

team_name.title:
pass value of team name if the owner of this new project should be a team and not a user
invoker of the request should either be a member of that team or an admin

git_ref.description: Optional git ref to checkout for this project.

schema.description: Parameters to create a new project.

get.summary:
Return a list of projects given a list of project IDs. This method will only return
projects that the calling user has access to, and can be used in situations where
information about a subset of projects (like project names) is needed.

parameters.name: project_ids
parameters.description: The list of project IDs to return projects for.

parameters.name: experiment.project_id
parameters.description: Project ID

parameters.name: experiment.id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the experiment.

name.description: Human readable name that identifies the experiment.

artifact_location.description: Location where artifacts for the experiment are stored.

created_at.description:
Birth date in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.uuZ format (ISO 8601 format).
Output only.

updated_at.description:
Last update in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.uuZ format (ISO 8601 format).
Output only.

lifecycle_stage.description: lifecycle_stage shows the status of experiment.

schema.description:
Experiment is basically where a user can group and organize all the efforts
that goes into developing a machine learning model.
Experiment names are unique across workspaces.

get.summary: Return one project.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description:
Identifier for a project, in the form of a 19 digit string.
Example: a1b2-c3d4-e5f6-g7h8

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project's identifier

parameters.name: project.id
parameters.description:
An opaque public identifier for the project.
Output only.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The project object containing some number of fields to update.

id.description:
An opaque public identifier for the project.
Output only.

name.description: The short name; does not include user/team.

default_engine_type.description: Whether this project uses engines or runtimes: "ml_runtime" or "legacy_engine".

created_at.description:
Birth date in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.uuZ format (ISO 8601 format).
Output only.

updated_at.description:
Last update in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.uuZ format (ISO 8601 format).
Output only.

creation_status.description:
Creation status of the project (e.g. creating, success, failure)
Output only.

permissions.description:
The permissions that the user making the api call has in this project.
This field is read-only, updates on this field will be ignored.

read.description: Read-only, aka Viewer. Can view code, data, and results.

write.description: Read-write, aka Contributor. Can view and modify all project resources.

admin.description:
Administrator. Can view and modify all project resources,
add new collaborators, and delete the project.

operator.description: operator can start or stop pre-existing jobs.

inherit.description: inherit is meant to be used only for teams.

shared_memory_limit.description: Additional shared memory limit that each engine in this project has, in MB.

environment.description: The environment variables configured for this project.

ephemeral_storage_request.description: The ephemeral storage requested for the project, in GB.

ephemeral_storage_limit.description: The ephemeral storage limit for the project, in GB.

get.summary: List applications, optionally filtered, sorted, and paginated.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project's identifier

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [bypass_authentication creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name script status subdomain]
where "status" can be one of the following: [running, stopping, stopped, starting, failed]
For example:
  search_filter = {"status":"running"}.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name script status updated_at].
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=-updated_at,name.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

post.summary: Create an application and implicitly start it immediately.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project's identifier

subdomain.title:
The subdomain of the application.
The application will be served at the URL http(s)://subdomain.<domain>

script.description: The script to run for the new application.

cpu.description: CPU cores to allocate to application (default 1).

memory.description: Memory in GB to allocate to application (default 1).

nvidia_gpu.description: Number of Nvidia GPUs to allocate to this application (default 0).

environment.description: Default environment variables to include in application.

kernel.description:
Kernel to run the job runs on. Possible values are
python3, python2, r, or scala. Leave blank for runtimes.

runtime_identifier.description: Runtime image identifier to run the application with.

runtime_addon_identifiers.description: Runtime addons to run the application with if using runtimes.

run_as.description: UserID of service account used to run the application.

cdv_app.title: Whether it is a CDV app or a non-CDV app

accelerator_label_id.title: Label to use for node selecting gpu/accelerator

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The public project identifier

parameters.name: application.id
parameters.description: public identifier of the application.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The application containing some number of fields to update.

script.title: The script to run for this application

cpu.description: The number of vCPU allocated for the job run application.

memory.description: The amount of memory allocated for the application (in GB).

nvidia_gpu.description: The number of Nvidia GPUs allocated for the application.

environment.title: String of environment variables in json format

runtime_identifier.description: Runtime image this application should run on.

runtime_addon_identifiers.description: The list of runtime addons that this application uses.

run_as.title:
userID of the service account that will be used to run the job.
If 0 is returned, it means that job will run as the logged in user

cdv_app.title: Whether it is a CDV app or a non-CDV app

accelerator_label_id.title: Label to use for node selecting gpu/accelerator

get.summary: List project collaborators.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project.

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [username, permission].
For example:
  search_filter={"username":"foo", "permission": "read"},.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [username, permission].
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=-username,+permission.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the collaborator to add.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the collaborator to add.

username.description: The username of the collaborator to add.

permission.description: The project permission of the collaborator to set.

schema.description: Request for adding a project collaborator.

get.summary: List all experiments in a given project.

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description: Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.

artifact_location.description:
Location where all artifacts for the experiment are stored.
URI of the directory where artifacts should be uploaded.
This can be a local path (starting with "/"), or a distributed file system (DFS)
path, like ``s3://bucket/directory`` or ``dbfs:/my/directory``.
If not set, the local ``./mlruns`` directory is  chosen.

schema.description: CreateExperimentRequest takes the project id and Experiment name.

get.summary: Return one experiment.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: ID of the associated experiment.

delete.summary: Delete an experiment that belongs to an experiment id.

get.summary: Returns a list of Runs that belong to an experiment.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project to list experiment runs in.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: Experiment ID to search over.

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [creator.email creator.name creator.username name status].
Dynamic search key words are supported for experiment runs.
Supported fields are [metrics tags params].

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are:
[created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username name start_time].
It also supports dynamic sort for metrics, tags and params.
"+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.

post.summary: Create a run for an experiment.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: ID of the associated experiment.

schema.description:
CreateExperimentRunRequest takes an experiment id and project id and
creates an ExperimentRun entry.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project where the experiment run lives

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: ID of the associated experiment.

parameters.name: run.id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the ExperimentRun.

start_time.description: Unix timestamp of when the ExperimentRun started in milliseconds.

end_time.description: Unix timestamp of when the ExperimentRun ended in milliseconds.

artifact_uri.description: Sub directory of actual experiment artifacts location.

timestamp.description: The timestamp at which this metric was recorded.

step.description: Step at which to log the metric.

items.description: Metric associated with a ExperimentRun, represented as a key-value pair.
Tag is used to add more metadata regarding an experiment/run.

path.description:
The relative path to the file or directory.
The path is relative to the base resource that this file represents.
For example, if it's a project file/directory, it will be relative to /home/cdsw.
Alternatively, if it's an experiment run artifact, it will be relative to the
experiment run's root artifact directory.

is_dir.description:
Whether the path is a directory.
Output only.

file_size.description:
Size in bytes. Unset for directories.
Output only.

items.description: Metadata of a single file or directory.

files.description: File location (relative to the experiment run's root artifact directory) and metadata for artifacts.

model_id.description: model_id of the registered model id.

items.description: RegisteredModelMetadata is used to represent model version metadata.

registered_model_metadata.description: RegisteredModelMetadata is used to show what model version is registered for this model.

get.summary:
Get metadata, metrics, params, tags and artifacts for a run. In the case where multiple metrics
with the same key are logged for a run, return only the value with the latest timestamp.
If there are multiple values with the latest timestamp, return the maximum of these values.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: ID of the associated experiment.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: ID of the ExperimentRun to fetch. Must be provided.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project the experiment run lives in.

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: The experiment the run is a part of.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to delete.

get.summary: Gets the all the recorded metrics for the key for a given run.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID

parameters.name: experiment_id
parameters.description: Experiment ID the run belongs to

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: ID of the ExperimentRun

parameters.name: metric_key
parameters.description: metric key name.

post.summary: Bulk delete an experiment run details like metrics, params, tags in one request.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: ID of the ExperimentRun to log under

run_id.title: ID of the ExperimentRun to log under

metrics.description: List of metric names to be deleted.

params.description: List of param names to be deleted.

schema.description: DeleteExperimentRunBatchRequest is used to  builk delete metrics, params, tags in one request.

post.summary: Bulk update an experiment run details like metrics, params, tags in one request.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: ID of the ExperimentRun to log under

run_id.title: ID of the ExperimentRun to log under

timestamp.description: The timestamp at which this metric was recorded.

step.description: Step at which to log the metric.

items.description: Metric associated with a ExperimentRun, represented as a key-value pair.
Tag is used to add more metadata regarding an experiment/run.

schema.description:
LogExperimentRunBatchRequest is used to bulk update ExperimentRun details
like metrics, params, and tags in one request.

get.summary: List files/subdirectories at a specified path

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project that contains the files to list.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to list, relative to project root (/home/cdsw)

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project that contains the file or directory.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file or directory to delete.

patch.summary: Update file metadata, such as renaming.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the project that contains the file or directory.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file to update, relative to /home/cdsw

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The FileInfo object representing the updated metadata for the file.

path.description:
The relative path to the file or directory.
The path is relative to the base resource that this file represents.
For example, if it's a project file/directory, it will be relative to /home/cdsw.
Alternatively, if it's an experiment run artifact, it will be relative to the
experiment run's root artifact directory.

is_dir.description:
Whether the path is a directory.
Output only.

file_size.description:
Size in bytes. Unset for directories.
Output only.

schema.description: Metadata of a single file or directory.

post.summary: upload a file as a multi-part upload

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project this model belongs to.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to upload, with the key being the location to upload to (relative to /home/cdsw)

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project this model belongs to.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file to download

get.summary: Returns all jobs, optionally filtered, sorted, and paginated.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project's identifier

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name paused script type].
For example:
  search_filter={"name":"foo","creator.name":"bar"},.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name paused script type updated_at],
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=+name,-created_at.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project containing the job.

project_id.description: ID of the project containing the job.

script.description: The script to run for the new job.

cpu.description: CPU cores to allocate to job runs for this job (default 1).

memory.description: Memory in GB to allocate to job runs for this job (default 1).

nvidia_gpu.description: Number of Nvidia GPUs to allocate to this job (default 0).

parent_job_id.title:
Optional dependent job if this new job is a dependency.
Setting this to a parent job will make this job run when the parent job
completes. Cannot be used alongside "schedule".
this is deprecated and alias of parent_id

environment.description: Default environment variables to include in job runs for this job.

arguments.title: Default arguments to pass to job runs for this job

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds of job runs for this job.

schedule.description:
Schedule to run a job automatically. Cannot be used in a dependency job.
Follows the cron format. For example, to execute the job every Monday
at 1 PM UTC, the schedule would be "0 13 * * 1" without quotes.

kernel.description:
Kernel to run the job runs on. Possible values are
python3, python2, r, or scala.
Should not be set if the project uses ML Runtimes.

notify_on_success.description: Whether to notify on job success.

notify_on_failure.description: Whether to notify on job failure.

notify_on_timeout.description: Whether to notify on job timeout.

notify_on_stop.description: Whether to notify when the job is stopped.

recipients.description:
An optional list of recipients to receive notifications for job events
such as successful runs, failures, and manual stops.

attachments.description:
Files to attach (with path relative to /home/cdsw/) in notification emails.
For example, to attach a file located at /home/cdsw/report/result.csv,
include "report/result.csv" in the array for this field.

runtime_identifier.description:
The runtime image identifier to use if this job is part of a ML Runtime project.
Must be set if using ML Runtimes.

runtime_addon_identifiers.description: A list of runtime addon identifiers associated with this job.

kill_on_timeout.description:
Whether to kill the job on timeout. This field does nothing if the timeout
is not set.

timezone.description:
Timezone of the job. Relevant only when schedule
(recurring jobs) is provided (default 'America/Los_Angeles').

paused.description:
Whether to create the job in paused state. Relevant only when schedule
(recurring jobs) is provided. Recurring jobs are put in un-paused state by default.

parent_id.description:
Optional dependent job if this new job is a dependency.
Setting this to a parent job will make this job run when the parent job
completes. Cannot be used alongside "schedule".

success_recipients.title: recipients that are notified when job succeeds

failure_recipients.title: recipients that are notified on when job fails

timeout_recipients.title: recipients that are notified when job times out

stopped_recipients.title: recipients that are notified when job stops

run_as.title:
userID of the service account user
defaults to userID of the creator

accelerator_label_id.title: Label to use for node selecting gpu/accelerator

schema.description: Parameters to create a new job.

get.summary: Return one job.

parameters.description: The public project identifier

Public identifier of the job.
Output only.

cpu.description: vCPU cores available for the job.

created_at.description:
When the job was created.
Output only.

creator.description:
The user that created the job.
Output only.

engine_image_id.description:
ID of the engine image. Will be 0 if using runtimes.
Output only.

parent_id.description: ID of the parent job - if the job is "dependent".

paused.description:
Whether the job is paused.
Output only.

script.description: The script to execute for the job.

timeout.description: Timeout of a job run for this job.

timezone.description:
Timezone of the job if this is a scheduled job.
Output only.

updated_at.description:
When the job was last updated.
Output only.

environment.description: The default environment variables for the job, as JSON.

nvidia_gpu.description: The number of nvidia GPUs allocated for this job.

runtime_identifier.description:
The runtime image identifier if this is a runtime job. Will be blank if
using engines.

runtime_addon_identifiers.description: The runtime addons associated with this job.

kill_on_timeout.description: Whether to kill this job when it times out.

run_as.title:
userID of the service account that will be used to run the job.
If 0 is returned, it means that job will run as the logged in user

accelerator_label_id.title: Label to use for node selecting gpu/accelerator

parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name paused script type],
where "status" can be one of the following: [scheduling, running, stopping, stopped, succeeded, failed, timedout]
For example:
  search_filter={"status":"running","id": "1"}.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username description kernel name paused script type updated_at]"
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=-updated_at,+name.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Page size is an optional argument for number of entries to return in one page.
If not specified, the server will determine a page size.
If specified, must be respecified for further requests when using the
provided next page token in the response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Page token is an optional argument for specifying which page of results to get.
If not specified, the first page will be returned, including a token for the next page.
Will be empty if there is no next page.

get.summary: List models, optionally filtered, sorted, and paginated.

parameters.name: project_id

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [auth_enabled creator.email creator.name creator.username description name].
For example:
  search_filter={"name":"foo","auth_enabled":"f"}.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [auth_enabled created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username description name updated_at].
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=created_at.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: page size of the response model build list.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: page token for specifying which page to return.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project containing the model.

project_id.description: ID of the project containing the model.

disable_authentication.description: Whether to disable authentication for requests to deployments of this model.

run_as.title:
optional userID of the service account to create/deploy the model
when not passed, creator's userID will be used to create/deploy the model

auto_build_config.title: Configuration to carry out model deployment

comment.description: A comment associated with the build.

file_path.description: The path to the file to build.

function_name.description: The function name to run when executing the build.

kernel.description: The kernel the model build should use.

runtime_identifier.description: The runtime ID the model build should use.

runtime_addon_identifiers.description: The runtime addons the model build should use, if using runtimes.

registered_model_version_id.description: ID of the registered model version.

auto_deployment_config.title: Configuration to carry out model deployment

cpu.description: Number of vCPU to allocate to the deployment.

memory.description: Amount of memory in GB to allocate to the deployment.

nvidia_gpus.description: Number of nvidia GPUs to allocate to the deployment.

environment.description: Environment variables to run the deployment with.

auto_build_model.title: build the model after successful creation

auto_deploy_model.title: deploy the model after successful creation and build. Only relevant when auto_build_model = true

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project containing the model.

parameters.name: model.id
parameters.description:
ID of the model.
A model CRN looks like <workspace CRN>/<UUID>. The ID is the UUID portion of the CRN.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The model containing some number of fields to update.

id.description:
ID of the model.
A model CRN looks like <workspace CRN>/<UUID>. The ID is the UUID portion of the CRN.

cpu_millicores.title: New number of cpu millicores for the model

memory_mb.title: New number of memory (in MB) for the model

nvidia_gpus.title: New number of Nvidia GPUs for the model

default_resources.title: Details of a model's default resources

num_replicas.title: Number of replicas to use for the model

default_replication_policy.title: Details of a model's default replication policy

run_as.title:
userID of the service account that should be used to deploy the model
Pass a value <=0 to reset it and to make use of logged in user's ID for future deployments

accelerator_label_id.title: Label to use for node selecting gpu/accelerator

schema.description: Parameters of a single model for the update flow.

get.summary: Get a model.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project this model belongs to.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The model's ID

parameters.description: ID of the project containing the model.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: ID of the model to delete.

get.summary: List model builds, optionally filtered, sorted, and paginated.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project containing the model.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: ID of the model to get builds for.

parameters.name: search_filter
parameters.description:
Search filter is an optional HTTP parameter to filter results by.
Supported search filter keys are: [comment creator.email creator.name creator.username crn status],
where "status" can be one of [pending, succeeded, built, build failed, timedout, pushing, queued, unknown]
For example:
  search_filter={"comment":"foo","status":"pending"}.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort is an optional HTTP parameter to sort results by.
Supported sort keys are: [built_at comment created_at creator.email creator.name creator.username crn status updated_at].
where "+" means sort by ascending order, and "-" means sort by descending order.
For example:
  sort=creator.email.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: page size of the response model build list.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: page token for specifying which page to return.

parameters.description: ID of the project containing the model build.

parameters.description: The ID of the model that will the build.
